Reviews.Title: “Bravo Alberto y Cristina!”
Reviews.Author: cindoverez
Reviews.Content: Old hotel with old world charm. Great location: Palace, Julia Travel Office, Principe Pio Metro AND San Miguel Market w/in walking distance. In reference to previous reviewer, traffic was noisy WITH WINDOW OPEN in Palace view room. Once closed, TOTALLY soundproof! Alberto and Cristina at the front desk were patient, knowledgeable and extremely helpful :)

Reviews.Title: “Just as bad as ever!”
Reviews.Author: KentCouple
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Madrid at the request of a major client and, once again, they made the mistake of putting me in the Principe Pio - luckily I got out after one night. Nothing has changed since my previous stay - impossible to sleep if on the front of the Hotel (i.e. the side facing the Palacio Real) no matter which floor you are on due to traffic noise which only stops between around 2 and 5 a.m., totally disinterested staff (I speak fluent Spanish and even though arguing for a room change to the back of the Hotel calmly and in good Castillian, they still treat anybody complaining like a dumb tourist). As to food, if you discount the vending machine in the bar which never opens, I suppose that a chocolate bar is the same anywhere in the world - the "sweet and salty" food at breakfast (bad translation from the Spanish "salado" in some of the reviews by somebody claiming to be British and Australian - I suggest that Tripadvisor check who really wrote those reviews) there is no food available - we all ended up buying doughnuts from a corner shop. All in all, if you want to actually stay in a Hotel where sleep is possible and where they are even interested in knowing what the word "service" means, go somewhere else. Worst Hotel that I have ever stayed in and I have stayed in some pretty awful dives in Asia and Latin America !

Reviews.Title: “Central and good staff”
Reviews.Author: Paul G
Reviews.Content: In a few words Principe Pio Hotel is in the historical center of Madrid. You can visit the more important of Madrid walking. I reserved a room with view to de Royal Palace and in the night is fantastic. The staff very very servicial. They inform us where were de more impotant monuments and museum and how to get it. Thanks Principe Pio PAul & Betty

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: brendanodonnell45
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Principe Pio & special mention must go to the staff, who were welcoming, efficient, friendly & professional. For a nominal fee our room was upgraded to one with a wonderful view of the Palacio Real. Our room was comfortable and clean, with excellent bathroom facilities. The air conditioning was particularly welcome as there was a heatwave at the time of our visit! Good value for money. We would certainly stay here again and would recommend the hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tara8775
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel in a perfect location. have stayed here twice and have found the staff to always be friendly and helpful. if i return to madrid i would be more than happy to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: WLA82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Principe Pio with co-workers for one night before moving to another hotel for a work conference. The hotel had been recomended by friends who had stayed there 8 years ago. I booked my room, which included breakfast, for 60Euro and got a large room in the back of the building, it was clean, comfortable and quiet. Despite the heatwave (104 degrees), my room was cool fortunately, one other room had a problem with the AC but she was on the top floor. The staff was very friendly and helpful, one front desk clerk even got a map and drew a route for us to walk around the area to make the most of our short time. The location is excellent, right down from the Plaza Espana and across from the Royal Palace and Cathedral. The Gran Via is very close, so there is plenty of shopping. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Confortable Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: silvy309
Reviews.Content: I've been twice in this hotel and would go back because I feel more comfortable as at home. The lobby is my favorite space looks really real. Cleanliness, courtesy and quality are 3 features that I found in Principe Pio. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, I have always been in rooms that have a wonderful view of the royal palace. Good breakfast buffet with a varied selection of sweet and salty foods and fruits. Not to mention the priceless central location where you can reach the main attractions on foot as well as having the metro and train station within walking distance. Great for business travelers, like me, convenient for wi fi and also for leisure travelers .. good value for money .. I recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Madrid best in class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eva P
Reviews.Content: After several visits to my favourite city in Spain and tested very different hotels, I think the Pricipe Pio has everything I would expect for an excellent 3 stars: location is simply perfect, the staff treated me like being at home but respectfully, the price I've paid hasn't been very expensive ever. No doubt they'll have me again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Paul G
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my wife and 9 year old daughter at the end of March for 4 nights at the Principe Pio. Booked the hotel 7 months in advance and requested a room with a view of the palace but ended up in room 610 with a view of a block of flats. After reading reviews regarding noise from the main road and the higher the room the better, I decided to stick with the room which was excellent. Clean, big and situated at the end of the corridor on the 6th floor, we could not have asked for more. The room was spacious, comfortable and kept very clean. An added bonus was the fact the safe was included in the price. I wish all hotels did the same as I think an extra charge for this is unfair. Booked room only and plenty of local places to go for breakfast but, as usual on the continent, do not expect a top quality English breakfast and the prices are a bit steep too. Location of hotel is excellent. I found Opera to be the best Metro station to use when returning to the hotel as the walk is downhill and takes you past the palace. All staff at the reception were excellent, willing to help and very efficient. We found the hotel welcoming, clean and value for money. Maybe we were lucky with the room but I would have no hesitation booking this hotel again when returning to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with great views of the Palace”
Reviews.Author: Jackie_Frederick
Reviews.Content: Principe Pio Hotel met all of our needs and considering it's superb location and reasonable price, we couldn't complain. Positives: - Excellent location -- In walking distance to the Palace, El Senado, Parque del Oeste, Templo de Debod, Plaza de España, and the Metro. We even walked to Puerta del Sol, the Opera House, and Plaza Mayor, but this is a slightly more ambitious walk. -The staff immediately accommodated our request for a room with a view of the Palace, which was magnificent. -When Iberia lost my luggage, the hotel made sure to follow up with the airline and notify me once my luggage arrived. - We found our room to be clean and spacious, by European standards. Negatives: - By American hotel standards, this hotel is a bit run down. Remember that this is Europe after all -- hotel rooms are much smaller, beds and pillows are basic, etc. - Hotel is on a busy street so it can get a bit noisy. As a young couple, we found this hotel to fit all of our needs perfectly. The hotel was clean, service was good, and location was fantastic. This is a great choice when you are on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for insomniacs - if you stay here, you will quickly become one !”
Reviews.Author: KentCouple
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4-day trip staying at the Principe Pio. First the good news - the rooms seem to have been renovated fairly recently (probably last few years), although there are the occasional defects (mould on seal around bath, etc.) and it faces the Royal palace, so a great position for tourism. Now the bad - I stayed here with a group of work colleagues - all of those who had rooms on the back of the hotel slept like a log - without exception, those of us on the front of the Hotel got a maximum of 2-3 hours' sleep. The basic problem is that the Principe Pio sits right on top of a major road, so when the traffic is moving, there is a wall of noise which hits every room on the front of the hotel, no matter which floor you are on (two of us were on the 5th. Floor) - the only time that sleep is possible is when the traffic dies down (between around 2 a.m. and 5 a.m. - after 5 there is an odd effect - there is a rush of traffic, then silence for a few minutes, then another rush of traffic - basically the silence is when the traffic-lights are on red ! It is clear that attempts have been made to rectify this problem - the windows have some of the biggest double-glazing units that I have ever seen, which originally must have had metal shutters in the middle of the two panes, presumably to cut down on light and noise - those shutters have since been removed and all that the large gap between the panes seems to do is to amplify the noise. The hotel could, of course, fit heavy, thick curtains to try to reduce the noise, but the curtains they have are some of the thinnest that I have seen. We did, of course, try to change rooms, but not surprisingly, all of the rooms at the back of the Hotel were taken for the whole of our stay - when telling us this, the receptionist had the strangest of wide smiles !!! We had planned to use this Hotel as the standard base for our regular visitors to our Madrid Head Office - instead, it will be placed on the growing black-list of hotels never to be used under any circumstances. If you value your sanity (sleep-deprivation can do strange things to the most stable of people) avoid this Hotel at all costs !!!

Reviews.Title: “location best thing about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: alan g
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for many of the sites and shopping. Local cafeterias serve really good food at low rates. No table cloths at these places but great food and local clientele. Hotel room was clean and towels etc. changed daily. Extremely noisy at night. Children running in the corridor above us. Walls must be paper thin as I could hear the gentleman in the next room snoring! No attended bar - really fancied a nightcap after our evening meals. Couldn´t find anybody who ate in! We sat in the reception area while waiting for our coach back together with about 30 others.. And there was not even a coffee available - what a wasted money spinner. Couldn´t really recommend this hotel but it has great potential.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Didam_de_banlieue
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in family in this hotel. It is well located near the Royal palace. It is quiet, not too central but very near the centre. Rooms are OK for the category. The restaurant is correct and not too expensive. We had our little dog with us, it is OK to have the dog go outside, there are quiet streets nearby. There is an internet lobby that is OK to check e-mails. There is a good ambience in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel to stay in Madrid far below 3star standards”
Reviews.Author: Gaurav1982
Reviews.Content: Rooms actually stink on 3rd and 5th floor where I stayed and it's bad, if with familiy , pls avoid , also I think they don't treat Asians well as I had clear indications that looking at us they provided worst that they had with them, service is next to zero and the hotel is really old , pls avoid

Reviews.Title: “Camera and IPod vanished”
Reviews.Author: mtakahashi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Principe Pio for 3 days. By leaving the hotel we forgot our camera and IPod in the room. We contacted the hotel in the same day and they sad nothing was found. We also went back to the hotel and nothing again. Absolutely sure we left them there because we took pictures of the room the night before leaving and the first time we wanted to use our camera, we couldn't find it. And to worsen our experience they gave us a smoking room without asking what we preferred. Room is good, but our experience was very compromised.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, never again !”
Reviews.Author: Dixiedoggy1
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? to say we were very disappointed is an understatement. We arrived in beautiful Madrid and after a lovely flight and taxi journey we proceded to check in to Hotel Principe Pio. A disinterested lady at reception proceeded to check us in. I asked for a room with a view of the nearby Palace and I was told all rooms for 3 persons were at the rear. I wanted a nice view because My sister and I took our 78 year old mother on a surprise birthday trip to Madrid. We booked the rooms on the net and the room we were put into was not satisfactory considering I paid €400 for 3 nights. The carpets throughout the hotel including the room were worn out and dirty. The bed linen was dirty. The camp bed was very short and not suitable for an adult. All the bed matresses were exceptionately hard and uncomfortable and the blankets felt like boards. I asked there was any posibility of getting a room with a palace view and I was quoted an extra €15 per night which would have brought the room bill to €445. I declined to pay it. The free WiFi did not work for us in our room or in the lobby. Because of the standards in the hotel we declined to eat there and went out to each meal even breakfast which was not included in the price. Only positive was the friendly guy in reception who arranged our taxi back to the airport yesterday, a very friendly nice guy, Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Biggest disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Terri N
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the biggest disappointment of our trip. Rooms smelled bad, no air conditioning, in bad need ao new carpet and breakfast was terrible. Only thing good was location. Do not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: Carol T
Reviews.Content: I visited this wonderful hotel in the 1970's and intend doing so again in the not too distant future. Wonderful staff, too. It hasn't changed from what I can see. Hope to be there soon

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MarceloColi
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Excellent location good bathroom too. But they really need to reform their wallpapers and carpets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great service, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: cinderella63
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent. The rooms big enough, but sparce, and the "free wifi" didn't work from our room, although others said it was very fast in their room. I didn't have any problem connecting in the lobby and business room, which provided comfy couches and tables. The breakfast was cold, but plentiful, and friendly staff there as well, and available until 11 am. Two elevators, parking garage next door, and only a few blocks from the mall in one direction and a couple of block from the main shopping streets in the other direction, I found the hotel to be in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - already been back!”
Reviews.Author: Carly S
Reviews.Content: Great value for money - the rooms were clean, spacious and the location is perfect for a city stay in Madrid. I recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel Excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: zazuHicksville
Reviews.Content: Arrived to Principe Pio Hotel on July 25th 2011 for a 2 night stay with my 21 and 16 yr olds. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Where ever we wanted to go the staff circled on maps and gave excellent directions. Also gave us good tips on where to eat. The room was very nice room 721 with a view of the Palace. Rooms are small but enough space needed for us. The beds were fine the pillows nice. We had an air conditioner that worked. The bathroom was excellent! There is a small closet with a safe. Yes from reading other reviews it is a little worn- they definitely should put new rugs down and new wallpaper. I booked through their website. No Problems what so ever! Having only been to Ireland in 2002 and stayed in B&B's, I didn't know what to expect from the reviews but tried to read between the lines. I think we made an excellent choice for the money location etc. We took the metro from the airport and it was very easy to find. people are very helpful all around and a lot of people speak english. I highly recommend this hotel and if I get the chance to return would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful Booking this Hotel online--These people are crooked”
Reviews.Author: TravelerATLanta__500
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel. I strongly recommend people be extremely careful booking this hotel online--These people are very crooked in their booking practices. I originally booked this hotel in early April using my credit card to guarantee the reservation for a trip to Madrid in early June for 4 night stay. Circumstances arose that forced me to cancel my trip to Madrid at the end of April. So I canceled the hotel reservation and I received an email acknowledging the cancellation. I then received a 2nd email from this hotel stating I had received a special discounted rate of 10% and the reservation could not be canceled. I received my credit card statement at the end of April and discovered that I had been billed for the entire 4 night stay. I am now engaged in a credit card dispute with this hotel over a bill almost $US 600 they claim I owe although I canceled the reservation and never used the room. Be very careful if you book this hotel online--These people are thieves!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Preston___B0y__
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Principe Pio Hotel and the location was outstanding. After a very easy journey from the airport on the Metro costing a mere 2 Euros, we arrived at PP and were shown to our good sized room with a great view of the Royal Palace and gardens. The reception staff spoke good English and provided us with a city map and offered us helpful local knowledge of faster routes on the Metro and advice on times to visit places. We didn't eat in the hotel in the evening but our room included breakfast which was a more than ample continental style affair and we were greeted warmly by the duty staff even though we were close to the finishing time on both days. The hotel is a little rustic in places but this adds to the overall charm of the place and for the price we paid and the location we could not have asked for more. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortableI and excellent customer service from the staff.”
Reviews.Author: lancashire028
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a 3 night stay at the Hotel Principe Pio. The Hotel was easy to get to from the Airport. We used the Metro System - line 8 from the Airport to Madrid centre, then line 10 to the Principe Pio metro station.The Hotel is about 4 mins walk from the Metro station. It is in a good location, overlooking the Royal Palace and within 15/20 mins walking distance of other main attractions. Although with a bus stop right outside the Hotel we made use of the circular bus which runs every 10 mins. I found the Hotel clean and comfortable with good sized rooms, comfortable beds, adequate bathroom and a safe in every room.Our room overlooked the Palace As we were on room only basis I cannot comment on food at the hotel but there are several tapas bars and restaurants nearby, A small tapas bar a few yards up from the hotel served excellent coffee and was our first stop every morning for coffee and pastries.. The staff at reception were extremely helpful,all spoke reasonable English and nothing was too much trouble. On checking in to my room i had a couple of 'senior moments' - unable to work the light switches, unable to open the safe- both times a call to reception and someone was there within minutes to sort out the problem. One young man at reception was particularily helpful recommending restaurants and eating places etc and making reservations to ensure we had a table.A good night out. not to be missed was a Flamenco night at Las Tablas- a small bar 5 mins walk from the hotel. Authentic Flamenco music and dance, 25 euros including 1 drink but well worth it./

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: Janet2158
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending 3 nights at the Principe Pio. The hotel is quite close to the centre, also there is a good Commercial Centre just 5 minutes walk away, with shops and restaurants. Our room was OK, but in need of some refurbishment. It was fairly clean, although the fridge had not been emptied from the previous occupant, and we had to call the maid in to empty it. We also asked for extra pillows which were provided the same day. The room was sadly lacking a hospitality tray, so there was nowhere you could get a hot drink which was very disappointing. We ate breakfast in the hotel on the last morning which was quite expensive for just a continental breakfast, but was better than anything we found outside the hotel. On the whole, we found the food in Madrid not of a good standard, and it was very rare to find anybody who spoke English, so communication with the few phrases that we picked up was quite difficult. The Metro was cheap and easy to use and the journey to and from the Airport was simple. Our favourite tourist attraction was the Cable Car which was an inexpensive way to spend a couple of hours.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Phyllisquot
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a Travelzoo offer of three nights in Madrid on a room only basis. The Easyjet flights from Bristol were straightforward and we found our way to the Principe Pio hotel by using the Metro. Madrid's Metro system is extremely efficient and easy to use. Single journeys to any place in the city cost 1 euro but to get to and from the airport costs 2 euros. The hotel is within a reasonable walking distance of the city and all it has to offer if you are wanting to explore on the way. There is a Haagen Das shop en route which we rarely passed without tasting something!! My husband says that he would have preferred to be more centrally placed if we went again for a future visit and we enjoy walking. The hotel room was comfortable with an excellent en-suite which included a bidet. The shower was excellent and there was always plenty of hot water. Tap water was cold and safe to drink and tasted like ours at home. We took a travel kettle and a supply of teabags and coffee which we were really glad to have. There is no fridge in the room but all milk is processed so our container lasted well throughout our stay. My great disappointment was due to the one pillow we were each provided with; they were hard and uncomfortable. I decided to purchase a pillow and found one shop that sold them but at an ehorbitant price! I noticed that the Spanish in this region only have hard pillows and I couldnt find a feather pillow or cushion. The double bed was also of an inferior quality but not too bad for our short stay. The hotel had at least 5 floors accessed by very efficient lifts and our room looked out onto the central area at the back so the nights were very quiet. It is true that the walls are fairly thin and we were kept awake by some noisy Spanish youngsters at times. The Spanish are very loud talkers - be warned!! Our towels were changed even though this was unnecessary. The only other thing I would say to would-be travellers is that English is not very widely understood in Madrid. We took a phrase book and managed reasonably well but I am sure we missed a lot by not speaking any Spanish. We came home dying for fresh salads and our own cooking after eating in little cafes and restaurants. The diet in these was mainly sweet : breakfast was thick hot chocolate and cold 'churros' (doughnuts) that you dunk. There are always french bread rolls with cheese or meat in them. They are aware of providing vegetarian options in restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “oh dear”
Reviews.Author: paramedidoc
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the Saturday as part of a package including flights and tickets to Real Madrid football ground. The woman who was on reception was very helpful and got out maps of Madrid to show us places to go and how to get there. We got to our room and couldn’t help thinking it was a little bit dirty, tired and worn. The carpet was stained and the walls marked and I didn’t really feel like walking around in bare feet. But hey, we were there to see Madrid and get in the atmosphere of the Bernabau stadium so we would only be there to sleep…that was until three young English girls unlocked the door to the room next to ours and started to play very loud music. We could hear every word they spoke through the walls…to say they were wafer thin would be an under statement…it was like they were sitting in the same room with us. We went down to see the guy behind the desk to ask for a room change, he told us that the place was full of students that weekend so there was no where for us to go…we didn’t want to complain about some youngsters having some fun and letting off steam so we asked for a hotel they recommended and we moved hotel as we couldn’t of slept there for a single night. The two guys at reception were so helpful and couldn’t say sorry enough to us. Overall I can’t recommend this hotel for anyone other than students who are going to party…if that’s you, you will love it, if not find somewhere else…I have no idea where the 3 stars came from, you would be lucky if I gave this hotel 1 start

Reviews.Title: “Very goodvalue for a central location”
Reviews.Author: hollybankcork
Reviews.Content: Arrived by train took metro from station a relatively short metro ride had to change once cost 2 euro got off at Plaza Easpana stop hotel is just down a short walk about 4\5 mins. The train station about a 35 min walk we got a taxi on return journey did not expect it to cost around 30 euros. The Palace is less than a 10 min walk and alot of the attractions are within walking distance .The start of The Grand Via only a couple of mins walk.Suggest a ticket on City tour bus we got a 2 day one . The hotel is v reasonable considering location around 70 euro for a double room breakfast costs around 8 euro very adequate if u do not want a cooked one ,which u can get a few doors up and will cost u less . They had a special menu for evening which was good and v reasonable. The Hotel is old but has character probably in need of updating ,rooms comfortable and a good shower We found Juan at reception extremely helpful. Plenty of good value Tapas Bars nearby

Reviews.Title: “Like Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: Petitbois
Reviews.Content: We had gotten bumped to this hotel from the4 star Hotel Opera. Although this one had 3 stars, it must have been rated years ago. It was very much like a 2 star. The small room had two twin beds, worn carpet, and a desk. Staff was rude, and we were charged what Hotel Opera charges (129 Euros), although their normal price for our room was about 70 Euros. The whole hotel seemed run-down, threadbare carpet, very Spartan.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average in every way really.”
Reviews.Author: Shrimpeses
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the outside is so nondescript we walked straight past it looking for it. The reception staff were ok, without being particularly helpful, the head chap we found a little cold, The fabled view of the palace didn't happen for us.We got the fabled view of a dirty rusty boiler / utility house,at the rear of the hotel. The rooms were ok, without being anything special. Cable tv was crap, on an important World Cup day , no Spanish game on at this hotel?!! Wi-Fi was a bonus though in fairness. They decided to rewire the lobby while we stayed and that got a bit inconvenient,and noisy at times. All in all a fairly ho-hum experience.

Reviews.Title: “What I expect from a hotel... and no more...”
Reviews.Author: plymouth
Reviews.Content: As per the most recent reviewer, there is nothing 'special' about the Principe Pio; there is an exterior 'calm' which is due to the room I had (see photograph) but, internally, the noise insulation is almost non-existent. Being woken several times each night (of three) by late arrivals - up to 02.30 - was not consistent with enjoying the following day. The room was of a good size and bathroom satisfactory - no more than that because it not only looked 'tired' but had one of the shelves coming away from the wall. Depending on where you want to be near to, the location of the hotel could be considered very good.

Reviews.Title: “What I expect from a hotel--with no surprises”
Reviews.Author: n2history
Reviews.Content: The Principe Pio, like many hotels in Madrid, has a non-descript exterior. The inside is much nicer, however, and everything conforms to my expectations of minimum standards. There staff were helpful in giving directions and restaurant recommendations, and making wake-up calls on time (not a machine). There is ample space in the lobby, with a large area for meeting clients or socializing. The hotel has two lifts, the second being rather small. My room, on the fifth floor, had two single beds, a small desk, closet with safe large enough for a laptop, and a view toward the royal palace. There was ample lighting, all controlled by wall switches. (Thank you for not making me try to find the switch on all of the lights and lamps!) The carpeting and furnishings show a bit of use, but the room was quite clean. The only downside to the room itself was the bright blue light emanating from the front panel of the TV. It made the room rather bright at night, and some people may choose to unplug the power. The bathroom was a good size, with full bath (half-sized shower panel kept most of the water in the tub). The soap and shampoo were of good quality and the towels were of high quality. Daily room service was quite good. The included breakfasts featured plenty of options--meets, cheeses, fruit, breads, yogurt, juice, coffee, and tea. No complaints here. I did not try the hotel restaurant (closed Mondays). The main problem that affected me was the quality of the in-room wireless. Kudos to the hotel for having a router on every floor, but the service was spotty and under repair for several days during my stay. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Principe Pio. For my standards, anything less would have been unacceptable. The proximity to two stations on the #10 Metro line, the royal palace, and several parks was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelier
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located opposite the Palace gardens in the middle of a hill. Very central. There is a bus stop in front and two Metro stations at either end of the Street. However, utilize the Metro at Plaza Espanza towards the left. Shorter walk up the hill. Or you can walk down the hill to the Principe Pio Metro and upon your return get off at The Plaza for the short walk down the hill to the hotel. We (4) utilized a Taxi to get around most often to the sights. It cost about the same (4 - 9 E) as the Metro. The Metro is not confusing to use. The Metro map is very very easy to read. It just takes time to get your barrings. We took 3 day trips outside of Madrid and utliized the Renfe rail service. Again, easy to use. The hotel itself was very clean, the staff accomodating, the rooms large, the bath large (compared to many hotels) and plenty of food with a large variety of items for breakfast. The lobby is very large, two elevators, a downstairs breakfast and banquet room. There is a bar area between the lobby and first floor. My only suggestion is that the hotel needs an upgrade: There are areas, that the carpet was worn, and sometimes stained. And in some areas, the wall paper was stained. All in all; a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geekish
Reviews.Content: My brother and i chose this hotel after looking at the reviews. Its a slightly dated hotel in terms of the decor, BUT, you cant fault the location. Its about a 5-7 minute walk to the station (there are 2 stations within walking distance), the Royal palace is near by. If you dont mind walking you could very well walk to many of the other areas from the hotel, (Sol, good for bars and resturants, Plaza de Mayor, to mention a few). If you can get a room at the front of the hotel you'll have amazing views of the Royal palace.If you end up with a room t the back of the hotel its alot less ... glamouous. The Bernabéu (Real Madrids stadium) is definately worth a vist, you'll need to go by train, but its so easy to use their underground system (the last station on any line tells you direction of travel, and its fairly cheap, 1 euro for a single trip to anywhere in the main areas). I wouldnt recommend a tourist travel card it works out expensive. Also, If you dont mind discovering Madrid yourself you'll find loads to see,especially if you walk (but take good walking shoes)) and in my opinion you wont really need to go on the bus tour guide. Really the only advantage of this is that you find out the history of the places you see but you could get a travel guide book which would do the same thing. If you are planning on hitting the clubs, beware, they dont really get going until 1:00am. untill then the bars are a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Just about!”
Reviews.Author: CCMJL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central, oposite the Royal Palace and quite handy if you want to walk to the centre instead of using the tube. Although, if you do prefer the tube, it's in between two stations so allow 5 minutes walk, at least, to either of them. The surounding area is not particularly great (8 lane carriage way, very busy all the time although barely audible from the rooms) but not particularly bad if you like to go out at night. The approach to the hotel is not particularly nice either. saying that, there are some nice little cafes a few yards away if you fancy breakfast or a coffee. The parking is nearby and for Madrid is a reasonable rate per day if you are staying in the hotel. The staff are very nice and very polite, they really make you feel welcome. We stayed in the 3rd floor. The room was very old in every possible way, from the carpets to the wall paper but not in a glamorous way. There were signs of old wet patches on some parts of the walls and ceiling. Two beds seems to be the standard rather than a double. The bathroom was newish and clean but the shower handle was broken and it took a few attempts to get the water running into the shower rather than all over the back wall. Sadly, on the second day we were there, we got some guests staying in the room above us who decided to have a shower at the same time as me. Somehow, their shower/bath water was comming in like a water fall over my head thought the grid in the ceiling and what an unpleasant experience to get somebody's shower waste all over your head, bathroom and the corridor. I'm not sure where the water came from but I have convince myself it was the shower or sink rather than the toilet! We were leaving that morning so we reported the problem but don't know if they fixed it or somebody else got a "niagara" experience also. Overall (and leaving out the shower experience) it was not a bad place to stay but overpriced in my opinion for what you get. Better value can be found elsewhere. However the staff are brilliant, it's well located, has parking and lifts but the rooms need quite a lot of attention. I have been in nicer rooms in guest houses in the UK for less.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: AthensSoloist
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel! I would definitely stay there again. I booked it through the "booking.com" site, at a very reasonable price. Central but quiet, located just a 5 minutes walk from the Plaza Espana, on the side of the Royal Palace. I asked for a double for single use room; I got room 714. It was comfortable, spotless and offered a wonderful view of the Royal Palace. The bathroom was excellent, towels were soft and changed everyday. Staff is very polite and everybody is smiling. Problems, however not of major importance to me: no choice of english speaking TV channels, apart from CNN. Breakfast selection could have been richer and breakfast room looks a little bit worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutey OK!”
Reviews.Author: maxp64
Reviews.Content: Very central position, just in front of the Royal Palace and very close to Opera, Porta del Sol and other nice place in Madrid. Very close to metro stations (Plaza de Espana, Principe Pio). Nice and clean rooms (a little bit noisy) and personnel friendly and helpful. Absolutely a good place to go if you want to enjoy Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bunter83
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel and good central location. Staff on reception were kind and helpful and had good english. Comfortable rooms with more than adequate facilities. Rooms cleaned and bed made every day! Great room for great price 40 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne88
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our experience of this slightly faded but very functional hotel- near to the train and buses as well as a comfortable walking distance to town , plus a good value breakfast cafe just a few doors up. the staff were extremely helpful and were keen to practice their English! a recommendation would be to ask for a room at the back of the hotel as this has a spectacular view of the palace (the best photo opportunity we came across!)

Reviews.Title: “stay away!”
Reviews.Author: n_olenka
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Madrid. Hotel advertizes itself as " in constant renovation" - well, expect noise of construction every 9 am! Staff at reception was extremely unhelpful and there is NO single iron in whole hotel - why would you need one, right !!!????? Worse if you have a car - THERE IS NO PARKING !!! Even if they say so while you are booking, dont believe it! Everything changes upon arrival, expect surprices .. and no help! Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is okay but the location is good”
Reviews.Author: LisaAndrea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Principe Pio hotel during the last leg of our honeymoon. The room itself was adequate, nothing fancy, you basically get what you pay for. We chose it because the price seemed reasonable and it seemed like a good location. My biggest complaint was that the "non-smoking" room smelled overwhelmingly like a "smoking" room. We had to sleep with our windows open every night but, since we faced the street, we were treated to noxious fumes from the passing buses. That being said, the location was perfect. It is right next to the Palace and it is close to all the sights. It is also nicely situated between two metro stops, which makes getting around easy, particularly to the Prado. Overall, the hotel was functional and the staff was pleasant. It met our basic need (a place to sleep) but did nothing to surpass our expectations. Another reviewer mentioned that they had since begun renovation. I'd be willing to give the place a try again (if the room rates stay about the same) to see if the hotel has improved.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Madrid 3/10/05 and i was very pleased with my stay at this hotel. The hotel staff where extremly friendly and helpful and spoke English very well. My room was always cleaned and never dirty. It is going through a renavation...looking like it is halfway done. When it is complete it is going to be beautiful. Great location...right at the Plaza de Espana...major Metro stop and a 5 min walk up the block to Gran Via which is equal to Broadway in New York City. If I went back to Madrid I would be more than happy to stay there again:)

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve its 3 star rating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling around Spain for our honeymoon in May of 2004. Of all the hotels we stayed it, Hotel Principe Pio was by far the worst. It began when instead of a non-smoking room we reserved on the inernet, we were put in a room that smelled like an ashtray. As it turned out, there wasn't a single non-smoking room in the entire hotel. The staff were less than interested in helping us and we stayed in our room with the windows opened for the duration of our stay in Madrid. The bed was made, but that was the only cleaning that was done, there were dust bunnies on the floor, there was mildew in the bathroom. We would not have spent more than 2 minutes in this hotel, however it was prepaid and regardless of our complaints, nobody wanted to refund us our money. If you value your sanity, do not stay at Hotel Principe Pio!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but tired”
Reviews.Author: simdee2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Principe Pio for a weekend. It is ideally situated 5 mins walk from the Royal Palace and 25 mins walk from Prado Museum. The hotel is old and tired but you can see that it was very plush in its time. It is cheap and comfortable and the staff are very friendly and helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Principe Pio Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Cuesta de San Vicente 14, 28008 Madrid, Spain
